title: Canada Issues 4,500 Express Entry Invitations to Apply for STEM Occupations
text: Are you a candidate with skills and qualifications in one of Canada’s 82 jobs for occupation-specific Express Entry draws? We want to help you move to Canada. Please submit your CV here. Canada has conducted a major targeted Express Entry draw for STEM occupations, issuing 4,500 Invitations to Apply (ITAs). The April 11 draw saw a minimum Comprehensive Ranking System (CRS) score of 491 points – 10 points higher than the STEM occupations draw before that, which was conducted on December 8, 2023, had a minimum CRS score of 481 points, and had issued 5,900 ITAs. The last draw was an all-program draw and was held a day prior, on April 10, 2024. It issued 1,280 ITAs with a minimum CRS of 549. Last year, Canada conducted the following draws: - 19 all-program draws - Five PNP draws - Six draws targeted at French speakers - Three draws targeted at healthcare occupations - Two draws targeted at STEM occupations - Two draws targeted at skilled trades - Two draws targeted at transport jobs - Two draws targeted at agriculture and agri-food occupations - One draw targeted at Federal Skilled Worker candidates This year, the following draws have been conducted: - Eight all-program draws - Three draws targeted at French speakers - One draw targeted at transport jobs - One draw targeted at agriculture and agri-food occupations - One draw targeted at healthcare occupations - One draw targeted at STEM occupations IRCC issued 110,266 ITAs in 2023, after inviting 45,115 candidates in the whole of 2022. IRCC issued a record 114,431 ITAs in 2021, to all Canadian Experience Class and Provincial Nominee Program candidates. It beat the previous record of 107,350 set in 2020. Read More: University of Alberta Scholarships Available to International Students British Columbia Issues 88 Canada Immigration Invitations In New PNP Draw Manitoba Targets Nurses, Retail Managers And Construction Workers In New PNP Draw Canada had a record immigration target of 465,000 for 2023, which it plans to surpass by setting the target of 485,000 permanent residency invites in 2024. The latest draw saw the tie-breaking rule implemented on February 25, 2024, at 7:55 am EST. If more than one candidate had the minimum CRS score, only those who submitted their Express Entry profiles before this date and time received invitations. This was the 15th round of invitations under https://www.immigration.ca/express-entry-immigration-2018/ in 2024 and 293rd overall . Candidates have a 60-day window to submit their applications, which will be processed within the six-month standard. Watch video: What Can Employers Do to Recruit Foreign Workers? Employers are encouraged to consider securing an LMIA or nomination under provincial nomination programs (PNPs) to ensure long-term retention of employees.
